page.title: 08Worlebury Golf Club
page.content: Worlebury Golf Club is up on the top of Worlebury Hill.It is a full 18 holes,19 acres course.Ladies and men can play.The club's history began when it was founded in 1909 and opened in 1912.The land had been owned by a quarry owner a Mr Henry Butt.Golf has been a popular sport for a long time.Worlebury Golf Club has 640 current players.The youngest is 7 years old and the oldest is 85 years old.If a child plays his course will be slightly shorter.After their round of golf the members can relax in the club house.In the meeting room there is a licensed bar.The course is overlooking the sea and there are some lovely scenes which almost make you forget to play real golf; especially when the weather is good!
